definition: see 拈花惹草[nian1 hua1 re3 cao3]
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
variant of 草[cao3]
grass/straw/manuscript/draft (of a document)/careless/rough/CL:棵[ke1],撮[zuo3],株[zhu1],根[gen1]
variant of 肏[cao4]
to nip/to grasp with the fingers/to fiddle with/Taiwan pr. [nian2]
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
old variant of 花[hua1]
variant of 花[hua1]/flower/blossom/also pr. [wei3]
see 沾花惹草[zhan1 hua1 re3 cao3]
lit. to buy smiles to seek happiness/abandon oneself to the pleasures of the flesh (idiom)
to stir up trouble (idiom)/to sow discord
tongues are wagging (idiom)
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
to say one thing and do another (idiom)
garrulous and sharp-tongued
to put on an act (idiom); to pose/to show theatrical affectation/to indulge in histrionics
lit. rat in a country shrine, fox on town walls; fig. unprincipled thugs who abuse others' power to bully and exploit people
worn out in body and soul (idiom)
arbitrary/indiscriminate
rosy-cheeked (idiom)
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
to offend people with unkind remarks (idiom)
to hold up buttocks and praise a fart (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
lit. pick orchids and present peonies (idiom); fig. presents between lovers
